channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-11
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PAIL DISCOVERED LEAKING/WET IN THE UNLOAD AREA. PAIL WAS PUNCTURED/CRACKED AT THE BOTTOM. PAIL PLACED INTO PLASTIC BAG AND DRUM AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT PROCESSING AREA. DescribePack: PAIL BECAME PUNCTURED/CRACKED AT THE BOTTOM. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PAIL WAS PLACED INTO A PLASTIC BAG AND HAZMAT DRUM TO PREVENT FURTHER LEAKAGE.

item.title: Report E-2023110580
item.description:
Report E-2023110580

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 16, 2023, five (5) 3-gallon pails of UN3267 were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed neutralizing granular absorbents to the spill and swept them in with hand tools. Crews used absorbent pads and a degreasing solution to wipe down the impacted freight and trailer floor, and then they restacked and repackaged the remediated freight for further shipment and processing. All neutralized product, absorbent pads, and miscellaneous cleanup debris were placed into two (2) 55-gallon drums.
